service: The Amazon Braket API Reference provides information about the operations and structures supported in Amazon Braket.

operations.GetDevice: Retrieves the devices available in Amazon Braket.
operations.ListTagsForResource: Shows the tags associated with this resource.
operations.SearchDevices: Searches for devices using the specified filters.
operations.SearchQuantumTasks: Searches for tasks that match the specified filter values.
operations.TagResource: Add a tag to the specified resource.

AccessDeniedException.base: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.

ConflictException.base: An error occurred due to a conflict.

refs.CreateQuantumTaskRequest$deviceParameter: The parameters for the device to run the task on.

refs.CreateQuantumTaskRequest$outputS3Bucket: The S3 bucket to store task result files in.

refs.CreateQuantumTaskRequest$outputS3KeyPref: The key prefix for the location in the S3 bucket to store task results in.

refs.CreateQuantumTaskRequest$shots: The number of shots to use for the task.

refs.CreateQuantumTaskRequest$deviceArn: The ARN of the device to run the task on.
refs.GetDeviceRequest$deviceArn: The ARN of the device to retrieve.
refs.GetQuantumTaskResponse$deviceArn: The ARN of the device the task was run on.
refs.QuantumTaskSummary$deviceArn: The ARN of the device the task ran on.

refs.SearchDevicesResponse$devices: An array of DeviceSummary objects for devices that match the specified filter values.

InternalServiceException.base: The request processing has failed because of an unknown error, exception, or failure.

refs.GetDeviceResponse$deviceCapabilities: Details about the capabilities of the device.
refs.GetQuantumTaskResponse$deviceParameters: The parameters for the device on which the task ran.

refs.GetQuantumTaskResponse$shots: The number of shots used in the task.

refs.CancelQuantumTaskRequest$quantumTaskArn: The ARN of the task to cancel.
refs.CreateQuantumTaskResponse$quantumTaskArn: The ARN of the task created by the request.
refs.GetQuantumTaskRequest$quantumTaskArn: the ARN of the task to retrieve.

refs.SearchQuantumTasksResponse$quantumTasks: An array of QuantumTaskSummary objects for tasks that match the specified filters.

SearchDevicesFilter.base: The filter to use for searching devices.

refs.SearchDevicesFilter$name: The name to use to filter results.

refs.SearchDevicesFilter$values: The values to use to filter results.

refs.SearchDevicesRequest$filters: The filter values to use to search for a device.

refs.SearchDevicesRequest$maxResults: The maximum number of results to return in the response.

SearchQuantumTasksFilter.base: A filter to use to search for tasks.

refs.SearchQuantumTasksFilter$operator: An operator to use in the filter.

refs.SearchQuantumTasksFilter$values: The values to use for the filter.

refs.SearchQuantumTasksRequest$maxResults: Maximum number of results to return in the response.

ServiceQuotaExceededException.base: The request failed because a service quota is exceeded.

refs.GetDeviceResponse$providerName: The name of the partner company for the device.
refs.GetQuantumTaskResponse$outputS3Bucket: The S3 bucket where task results are stored.
refs.GetQuantumTaskResponse$outputS3Directory: The folder in the S3 bucket where task results are stored.
refs.ListTagsForResourceRequest$resourceArn: Specify the resourceArn for the resource whose tags to display.
refs.QuantumTaskSummary$outputS3Bucket: The S3 bucket where the task result file is stored..
refs.QuantumTaskSummary$outputS3Directory: The folder in the S3 bucket where the task result file is stored.
refs.SearchDevicesRequest$nextToken: A token used for pagination of results returned in the response. Use the token returned from the previous request continue results where the previous request ended.
refs.SearchDevicesResponse$nextToken: A token used for pagination of results, or null if there are no additional results. Use the token value in a subsequent request to continue results where the previous request ended.
refs.SearchQuantumTasksRequest$nextToken: A token used for pagination of results returned in the response. Use the token returned from the previous request continue results where the previous request ended.
refs.SearchQuantumTasksResponse$nextToken: A token used for pagination of results, or null if there are no additional results. Use the token value in a subsequent request to continue results where the previous request ended.
refs.TagResourceRequest$resourceArn: Specify the resourceArn of the resource to which a tag will be added.
refs.UntagResourceRequest$resourceArn: Specify the resourceArn for the resource from which to remove the tags.

refs.CancelQuantumTaskRequest$clientToken: The client token associated with the request.
refs.CreateQuantumTaskRequest$clientToken: The client token associated with the request.
refs.SearchQuantumTasksFilter$name: The name of the device used for the task.

refs.GetQuantumTaskResponse$createdAt: The time at which the task was created.
refs.GetQuantumTaskResponse$endedAt: The time at which the task ended.
refs.QuantumTaskSummary$createdAt: The time at which the task was created.
refs.QuantumTaskSummary$endedAt: The time at which the task finished.

refs.UntagResourceRequest$tagKeys: Specify the keys for the tags to remove from the resource.

refs.CreateQuantumTaskRequest$tags: Tags to be added to the quantum task you're creating.
refs.GetQuantumTaskResponse$tags: The tags that belong to this task.
refs.ListTagsForResourceResponse$tags: Displays the key, value pairs of tags associated with this resource.
refs.QuantumTaskSummary$tags: Displays the key, value pairs of tags associated with this quantum task.
refs.TagResourceRequest$tags: Specify the tags to add to the resource.

ValidationException.base: The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by an AWS service.
